arts.ttl: PSG Boosted as Chelsea’s £52M-Rated Outcast Unlikely to Join Bayern in January
arts.sum: Christopher Nkunku’s future at Chelsea is up in the air, with several top European clubs reportedly eyeing a move for the forward. According to Graeme Bailey of TBR Football, the 27-year-old could be on the move as soon as January, with his representatives looking into potential options elsewhere. arts.ttl: Lens near agreement to sign former Arsenal and Brighton goalkeeper Mathew Ryan
arts.sum: Lens are nearing an agreement to sign Australia international goalkeeper Mathew Ryan (32), according to a report from L’Equipe. Will Still’s Artois side were in the market for a goalkeeper…

arts.ttl: Tottenham, PSG At Odds Over Potential Deal Involving €35M-Rated Aston Villa Target
arts.sum: Milan Škriniar’s future at Paris Saint-Germain is uncertain, with manager Luis Enrique seemingly favoring Willian Pacho and Marquinhos as his first-choice center-back pairing. This has sparked fresh speculation about Škriniar’s potential departure. After turning down offers in the summer, the Slovak defender could now be open to a move, with the January transfer window approaching. This situation has reignited speculation about Škriniar’s potential departure. arts.ttl: Man Utd Likely to Sell Chelsea, Tottenham’s £70M-Rated Target Abroad Amid PSG Rumors
arts.sum: Rúben Amorim’s decision to leave Alejandro Garnacho out of last month’s Manchester derby has fueled speculation about the winger’s future at Manchester United. However, one club aren’t likely to land the player before the January window closes. arts.ttl: Video: Bradley Barcola Uses the Crossbar to Score Impressive Late Winner vs. Lens
arts.sum: In the dying minutes of their contest against RC Lens on Saturday, Paris Saint-Germain secured all three points with a game-winning goal from Bradley Barcola in the 86th minute. Barcola scored on a right-footed shot from the left side of the box to the top right corner off an assist from João Neves. Despite the […] The post Video: Bradley Barcola Uses the Crossbar to Score Impressive Late Winner vs. Lens appeared first on PSG Talk.

arts.ttl: Barcola scores and assists as PSG struggles past Lens with Man City next in crunch match
arts.sum: The win extended PSG’s lead in the standings to 10 points but did little to mask the defensive frailties of Luis Enrique’s team ahead of a crucial Champions League match against Manchester City next week. Lens then caused havoc in the PSG defense several times but could not convert its chances because of Donnarumma.

arts.ttl: Barcola scores late winner as PSG sink Lens
arts.sum: A late goal from Bradley Barcola earned Paris Saint-Germain a 2-1 victory at Lens and keep the French champions well clear at the top of Ligue 1.
